objective: To verify that the electrical insulation of a PV module can withstand the specified test voltage without breakdown or excessive leakage current
scope: This test applies to all crystalline silicon and thin-film PV modules intended for use in Class A and Class B applications

test_voltage.note: For modules rated up to 1000V; higher voltages may require different calculation

test_duration.note: Voltage must be maintained steady for full duration

leakage_current.note: Current trip or alarm typically set at this level

pass_criteria: No dielectric breakdown or flashover during test
No visible signs of tracking on module surface
Maximum leakage current ≤ 50 mA during test
No visible damage to module after test
No delamination, bubbling, or burn marks
fail_criteria: Visible damage, burn marks, or delamination after test

module_conditioning.stabilization: Allow module to stabilize to ambient conditions before test

electrical_connections.active_parts: All electrically active parts (terminals, frames, cells, metallic parts) short-circuited together
electrical_connections.test_voltage_application: Between short-circuited active parts and grounded test plate/ground reference
electrical_connections.grounding: Test plate must be connected to protective earth

test_plate.size: Must be larger than module in all dimensions
test_plate.surface: Flat, clean, and free of sharp edges
test_plate.grounding: Connected to earth ground with low impedance connection

atmospheric_pressure.note: Equivalent to altitudes from sea level to approximately 1500m

dielectric_strength_tester.voltage_range: 0 to at least 1.5 × maximum test voltage

calibration.traceability: Calibration must be traceable to national/international standards

personnel_qualifications: Authorized to work on high voltage equipment
personal_protective_equipment: Insulated gloves rated for test voltage
test_area_requirements: Adequate working space around test setup
safety_procedures: Two-person rule for high voltage work (recommended)
Ground and discharge before and after test
Keep one hand behind back during energized operations

photographic_documentation: Module before test (overall and any defects)
Module after test (overall and any new defects)

acceptance_sampling.note: Sample size and acceptance criteria per specific qualification standard or customer requirements
acceptance_sampling.typical: IEC 61215 typically requires testing minimum number of modules from production lot

reference_standards.title: Photovoltaic (PV) module safety qualification - Part 2: Requirements for testing
Terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules - Design qualification and type approval
Insulation coordination for equipment within low-voltage systems
Protection against electric shock - Common aspects for installation and equipment

notes: This test verifies insulation integrity at one point in time; ongoing degradation not assessed
Test is destructive if module fails; failed modules typically cannot be repaired
Test does not simulate all field conditions (UV, thermal cycling, mechanical stress)
Results applicable to tested sample only; not predictive of entire production
Test voltage based on rated system voltage; actual field stress may vary

typically_performed_with: MST 14 - Damp Heat Test (if part of qualification sequence)
related_tests.sequence_dependency: Should be performed after conditioning tests if part of qualification sequence
